definition: to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: The computer cost so much that she didn't buy it.
sentences.chinese: 这台计算机太贵一直她买不起。

sentences.english: Sam could not supply (to purchase) the camera he longed for for it was too expensive.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆买不起他极想要那种照相机，因为那相机太贵了。

sentences.english: But the home of Kuang Heng be very poor, can not afford to buy light-on oil, how do?
sentences.chinese: 可是匡衡家里很穷，买不起点灯的油，怎么办呢？

sentences.english: This hat is so expensive that I can't afford it.
sentences.chinese: 这顶帽子贵得也太离谱了，我买不起。

sentences.english: But at least their taxes will allow other people to stay in homes they can't afford.
sentences.chinese: 但至少房贷税收会让买不起房的那些人有房住。

sentences.english: We can‘t afford that expensive sports car.
sentences.chinese: 我们买不起那辆昂贵的跑车。

sentences.english: When did admitting you can’t afford something become shameful?
sentences.chinese: 在什么时候承认你买不起一些东西会变得羞愧难当呢？

sentences.english: In India can not afford even the onion, it means that hardly a bite out.
sentences.chinese: 在印度连洋葱都买不起，就意味着几乎不能吃菜了。

sentences.english: Tom could not afford the camera that he wants, because that camera is too expensive.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆买不起那种他极想要的相机，因为那相机太贵了。

sentences.english: This pair of shoes is too expensive for me to buy.
sentences.chinese: 这双贵鞋太贵了，我买不起。

sentences.english: My father, even my family could not afford it at all.
sentences.chinese: 那年头，我父亲，甚至我们全家也买不起它。

sentences.english: He used a stick blackened in the fire to write because he couldn't even afford a pencil!
sentences.chinese: 因为他连铅笔都买不起，他只能用烧黑的木棍写字。

sentences.english: All of my clothes look so old and I can’t afford something new.
sentences.chinese: 我所有的衣服看上去都很旧，我买不起新的。

sentences.english: Well, you know that old bromide “If you have to ask you can’t afford it?”
sentences.chinese: 如果你知道那句老话“你问了你还买不起吗？”

sentences.english: I would like to drink some milk but I can't buy it," Edson James Kamba of Malawi said.
sentences.chinese: 我想喝牛奶，但我买不起。

sentences.english: But then, much of the content in these products is made by low-wage workers there who can’t afford the finished goods.
sentences.chinese: 但制造这些产品的工人却拿着低薪，根本买不起成品。

definition: to be embarrassingly short of money
to live frugally/to economize on food and clothing/to scrimp and save
to save on food and clothing (idiom); to live frugally
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
to be willing to sacrifice everything one has (idiom)
to economize on clothes and food/to scrimp and save (idiom)
poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly
